website_summaries.verdict: Great for adult violin students who want to start out slowly and work up to a more expensive instrument.
pros: Includes two bows, two rosins, and a tuner
Overall tone is comparable to higher-end models
Affordable full size violin for those who have graduated to that size
Tone is surprisingly rich for its price
cons: E string has inherent tone problems – entire set of strings may need replacement

customer_reviews.title: price-performance ratio is good
customer_reviews.text: Off course it is not the sound of a multiple thousand dollar violins but enough for a beginner. After your child is sure to continue with the violin than it should get a violin with a better sound from a local shop especially for competitions. Tuning Pegs have to be pushed in very hard in the Peg Box. Every new violin has to be plaid longer to develop a better sound. The video shows after tuning and first add on of resin on the bow. (played by my oldest son stopped playing multiple years ago). But he thinks it is a very good price-performance ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: It looks great, but only buy this if you want to ...
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this a zero, I would. I ordered this violin a year ago. It has never been playable. I contacted the company and they never contacted me back. The violin teacher told me it won't stay in tune. The bow can't be tightened enough to be used. It looks great, but only buy this if you want to use this violin as a decoration. Extremely disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: JZC

customer_reviews.title: Great little starter kit
customer_reviews.text: So like many others, I was hesitant to buy this product. I was like no way can a violin be this inexpensive. The local stores want an arm and a leg!! I figured i'd give it a try and I'm glad I did. My daughter loves her violin and carrying case. She says its "soooo lightweight compared to my friends". She hasn't had a problem with her violin and been using it for orchestra. If you considering buying a beginners violin id say this would be a perfect start.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy even as a toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a starter violin for 8yrs old girl just to start lessons to see if she'll like it. Used it 3 times and not usable since. The strings can't make a sound. The teacher tried to tune and didn't work. He said this isn't a real violin and very poor quality. I knew this wasn't a real violin but I expected it to last at least a year for 139.99
customer_reviews.author: apricot

customer_reviews.title: Good for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: This was cheap and is good for beginners. Since it's cheap, of course it won't sound stunning. But this is a good start to grasp the notes and how it should sound. You can tinker with the tuning as well to get used to it. I recommend handling it lightly the first few days so the strings don't snap if you handle it too quick. Looking online to figure out how to work your violin also helps a lot. There's a lot of videos on youtube. I haven't touched one since middle school so I'm basically a complete beginner again. It came nicely packaged and all in one piece. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Selena

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and perfect beginners
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 13 year old daughter for her birthday for a first time violin. I do not know anything about violins so I brought it to a luthier to be tuned and check the bridge etc. He said it was darn near perfect and the strings were good quality. He said it had better hardware than most beginners. Just needed tuned and one peg needed tightened. He did mention each bow will only last for 6 months, but for a beginner and it comes with two bows, win win. I did buy better rosin because of what I heard in other reviews. Expect to pay another 70-100$ for a luthier to tune and look at the violin.
customer_reviews.author: patrick beres

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I chose this violin at the recommendation of Allison Sparrow on Youtube, the online piano and violin teacher, from the UK. She rated it pretty high for a violin around $135 bucks. It is actually pretty decent, and the sound and volume are substantial. There was one setback. Two of the fine tuners would not turn, at all. I took it to an instrument repair shop, and they fixed them. $6.00 bucks each to repair, and I was off and running. I would expect little things like that are hit and miss for such an inexpensive instrument. Still, this was a killer deal for a beginner violin.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis Ellison-Williams

customer_reviews.title: Was inebriated, just wanted a violin.
customer_reviews.text: During one of my drunken stupors, I got bored and ordered a violin. I am not disappointed one bit. A few YouTube tutorials and voila!, I got it tuned and making loud noises. Now making music is going to be the hard part. I digress, anyways the violin is absolutely beautiful, packed very well to protect the bridge etc. case is very sturdy and the product is higher quality than I ever expected for the price. Comes as described and ready to use (other than getting rosin on the bow and a tune.
customer_reviews.author: John Huff

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for this package deal, but they are all pretty much the same quality at this price point. Not FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: Tuner is junk. Violin seems good. bows look good. its not a PRO violin by any stretch but is great for the price and for a beginner. this package deal i think surpasses the price range by a few bucks, so i think this is a pretty good deal here. nice case too. for a 130 bucks you cant go wrong. i do think that most violins in this price range will be very close in quality. Cecilio CVN-300 violin in 1/4 size. perfect for my daughter to learn how to play. i think this is a generous package at a reasonable fair price. no complaints. the gloss finish looks nice too.
customer_reviews.author: JUNK HATER

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive investment for undecided student
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, brand new, this violin was an inexpensive investment to see if a child is going to stick it out. We have owned this violin for 15 months and my daughter practices about an hour every day. After a year, the violin has not held up well. The string requires constant adjustment and has gotten worst over the year. The pegs keeps on slipping. The tone has gotten worst over the year. It's probably time to change the strings and pegs, but our daughter deserves a better instrument for her hard work. I will probably donate this to the school violin program.
customer_reviews.author: TwinCam

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. Did a lot of research before buying it. Very cheap yet very good. Comes with 2 bows 2 rosin and an extra bridge as well as a book and a tuner. First things first buy new strings because as soon as you try to tune the ones that come with it they break. The tuning pegs you have to press in as you tune. Dont believe that to be normal as this is my first voilin but not a big deal. Tuner is alright. I have my own seperate tuner for guitar/bass/voilin. All in all a very good purchase I certainly love it.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected. Ok quality & great price
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer-I know virtually nothing about violins except what they should sound like and that good, or even decent ones, cost as much as used car. That being said, it arrived intact and sounds like a violin should. Its it high quality? No. It is worth the money spent though, and seems like a great budget deal for a beginner or someone who wants learn to play, like myself. I tried another brand at this pricepoint and thank goodness for return policies, this one is WAY better. My advice, its a good buy for the price if you have a budget or an indecisive individual.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Beginner Violin
customer_reviews.text: At this price point, don't expect to purchase this and go perform concerts with it- this is an excellent instrument for beginner players in their first 1-2 years of violin playing. The case and instrument are very high quality and the strings are passable; however, the bows and rosin are garbage and the tuner/metronome is on the low end. This can all be overlooked for this price point, as you're getting a whole kit for what many high-end string sets cost. Would definitely recommend this kit to those venturing into the violin world for the first time. I learned on this violin and had nothing but a positive experience with it.
customer_reviews.author: Landon DoddTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. If I could give zero stars I would. As soon as I opened it, the case was cheaply made, the bows were jammed in the case and the hairs were broken. I still don't know how they got the bows to fit in there. The bridge had two sets of notches in it and the g string would not tune correctly. The craftsmanship was horrible and it brought no joy to my daughter on her birthday. This product is trash. Don't buy this unless you want to be immensely disappointed. Ruined my daughter's day! It looks as though we got one that was sent back!
customer_reviews.author: April M.

customer_reviews.title: Works for elementary school music lessons
customer_reviews.text: When the school dropped a note that my child needs to come to class with a mini violin, instead of a panic run to the local stores they recommended, I turned faithfully towards Amazon. This was one of the options with the most positive reviews. I know nothing of music. As I understand from my child, the violin has met the expectations from the teacher, and he will continue to use it. In appearance, it looks like a quality product. Comes with a case, tuner, bows, and a book, making it a complete product instead of needing another run to the store / another order to round off a standard use case.
customer_reviews.author: Kundan Sen

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic starter violin
customer_reviews.text: At 42 I decided to learn to play violin. I'm teaching myself. I researched...a lot. This is a fantastic starter violin. It holds a tune...And I practice at least an hour daily and always leave it out of the case to remind me to practice. If you research proper use of rosin, and find a good balance between too much and not enough you get a good tone from this violin. I'm truly enjoying learning to play on this violin. One day if I get amazing at this, I'll dish out more money for a better model....But this is perfect for now.
customer_reviews.author: JNB91

customer_reviews.title: Plays/sounds great! Watched You Tube to tune & rosin initially.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome beginner violin!!! After watching a few YouTube videos on how to set up the strings, which if done properly prevents the pegs from slipping, tuning, and how to rosin the bows (lightly sandpapered the rosin surface before using it on the bows), the violin created a great sound. I am new to the violin but not music and instruments and I couldn't be happier with the price and quality of this beginner violin and all of the goodies it came with!!
customer_reviews.author: JRo

customer_reviews.title: Orchestra Teacher Approves!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this violin for my niece who is a beginner in the school orchestra. I had no idea what to get, so I relied on the reviews and buyers seemed to really like this brand. Her teacher is said to be very selective when it comes to violins. She says that when it’s time to demonstrate in class, the teacher asks for permission to use her violin for the lesson! That was all I needed to hear!
customer_reviews.author: Mama's Girl

customer_reviews.title: New to Violin really liked it
customer_reviews.text: My Son and Self started learning Violin. He is going for Western-style and I am for Carnatic Style. He is renting a very costly violin and I am a beginner so after reading so many reviews I have selected this violin. This one didn't upset me and the sound is great. For beginners, I will highly recommend this violin. it will take 2/3 weeks to settle down after that you will really love it.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: No quality control
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a second violin for my son who has played for 6 years and an intermediate player. This violin is not standard. My son said that the fingerboard is not standard and that his fingers have to be placed tighter. There appears to be no quality control. Do not recommend even as a beginners’ violin
customer_reviews.author: E-consumer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy customer!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for the amazing price! Our daughter was interested in playing an instrument. We could not afford an expensive package from a music store. Thank goodness for CECILIO for providing a BEAUTIFUL violin and all the accessories to get her started on her musical journey. On Christmas morning she was thrilled and has been playing ever since! It truly is a wonderful deal and the accessories are generous! Thank you for making the gift of music affordable, a complete starter package and gorgeous instrument! Super customer service too....top notch company!
customer_reviews.author: Style in Vermont

customer_reviews.title: Great student violin.
customer_reviews.text: Great violin at a great price. Got this for my daughter bc renting was costing me a lot of money per year so when she graduated to full size this was cost effective. Was scared it would sound horrible but her teacher doesn't even notice a difference. I read lots of reviews before purchasing and I would say don't hesitate to buy this one. Even comes with all the accessories for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Not bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner to the violin but not to music. It's a great price for beginners for sure. However, the tuner like all the other reviews are saying is terrible. They send you a battery, but it has a terrible mic for input and barely works. I haven't used the metronome portion yet. Also the book for beginners isn't great either. They don't tell you how to tune the strings or finger placements which are rather important. I've been following some YouTube videos for the very start. But the initial songs are fine to follow. All in all, not the best ever, but quite good for the beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: got this instead of renting one out for school
customer_reviews.text: Daughter needed a violin and decided that it would be more cost effective to purchase instead of renting. the kit comes with extras that make the price worth buying vs renting.
customer_reviews.author: Ferndozer

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye lootboxes, hello violin strings
customer_reviews.text: This violin costs as much as a modern video game, but what you get is so much more. I was worried this might be too good to be true, but I understand now. This instrument is priced for accessibility, and I got exactly what I paid for. This is an instrument, and not a toy. It is just as ready to command an audience as you are. The pegs are a little loose and wobbly at first, so don’t be afraid to introduce them to some elbow grease
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: Great violin for the $$
customer_reviews.text: Previously I had bought a crescent violin. What a difference a couple of dollars makes with the instruments 🎻. I am an old hen learning an instrument self teaching and I am extremely happy with the instrument. The violin already has the bridge set on. You also have a replacement bridge two bows high quality rosin. Book and a tuner metronome. It also has a shoulder rest. It’s great for the beginner virtuoso in the making.
customer_reviews.author: Layren

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This violin works great! I'm sure it will last a long time, along with the other parts like the bow, rosin, the chin rest, the tuner, and anything I forgot. Despite the chin rest being too big, even adjusted to its smallest size, and the d string on the bow keeps going off tune, even right after being tuned, it's still a really good violin, since I have solutions to the problems.
customer_reviews.author: Leona Wankowski

customer_reviews.title: Good violin and extras, except the bow! Better bow makes a better sound.
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice violins for the money. The only weak spot in my opinion is the bows. They really aren't very good. Half of playing the violin is a good bow. There are very nice carbon fiber bows from vingo for $30. Dollars that make the whole thing just right.
customer_reviews.author: sjbrn1Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Good quality violin with good accessories
customer_reviews.text: After reading a lot of good and bad reviews for many violins and for this one as well, I decided to buy this violin for my son who is at 4th grade. I really thank you hence the product is really same on the listing and the material of it is better than my expectation. He has been using it for more than 3 months and we didn't have any problem except one of its spring was detached.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Kit isn't worth it
customer_reviews.text: The true quality of this violin is bad enough for it to deserve a one star rating. It's good if you're buying it for a kid who isn't going to be taking it seriously and just wants to have fun, but trust me the sound won't ever be good. Neither will the durability. You can get mucher higher quality, real violins at similar prices, so why would you buy this?
customer_reviews.author: Grant S.

customer_reviews.title: Everything is in good working order so far
customer_reviews.text: Everything is in good working order so far. I did not care for the chin rest so I tossed it aside. But the violin is well built, sounds like a normal violin. The pegs don't slip, the tuner is working fine, the rosin (is like any rosin). I like the music book, its small and a fun beginning book. the strings, are like any steel core string. and the Bows are your typical violin bows. All in all great purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tconklin

customer_reviews.title: Needs extra work before playing well
customer_reviews.text: I don't know much about violins myself but while tunning the violin I could tell immediately that it will be a bit of a problem. I had it checked at a local music repair shop and they said that the bow is very poor quality but it is usable for a beginner. However pegs are very bad and need to be reset. Cost $72. Other than that the strings are ok and if you tune the violin it actually has a nice sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jolanta Zasadni

customer_reviews.title: Very nice student/intermediate violin.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I would change about this is the bows. They aren’t that good, good enough for an absolute beginner but anything better than that and a bow upgrade is necessary. The tone is nice and it looks very pretty. My sound post was a little off in position, but I was able to move it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great price for everything you get!!
customer_reviews.text: I received it in 2 days (Prime). Everything was in perfect condition. I love all of the additional items that came with the violin such as 2 bows, electronic tuner, etc. It was a little tough to tune, especially the high and thin E string. My recommendation is to take it to a shop so they can tune it for you professionally and show you how to do it otherwise, you risk snapping the strings. I also had problems keeping it in tune at first. I'm having a lot of fun with it and it's a great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa K. McKee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value--Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I will premise by saying this was a Christmas gift for my then 7-year-old daughter, and while we haven't officially started with lessons (which makes its everyday use very limited), I have had two friends well-versed in violins take a look and they were shocked by the deal. Excellent quality, very aesthetically pleasing, and I'm looking forward to my daughter learning.
customer_reviews.author: PapaBear615

customer_reviews.title: Great violin, but get a different rosin.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this violin for a couple months now and I am absolutely in love with this instrument! I have always wanted to learn to play the violin and when I saw this violin at such a low price, I had to get it. The sound is beautiful, but I would not recommend using the rosin that came with this bow. The rosin is cheap and just by getting a better quality rosin which wasn't very expencive, my sound improved SO much. Other than the rosin, everything else is fantastic. LOVE this violin so so much.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Leah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and will get you started
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this instrument. The amount of goodies you get included is immense. The instrument quality is amazing for the price. It is no $2000 violin, but far exceeds my expectations for the price. I did get a new bow as the ones included were very bouncy (a little light?). I'm a new violinist and am glad I made this decision.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Mine came with broken A string and fallen soundpost  But its still a good value
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with a broken A string and fallen soundpost. So I had to immediately order another set of strings and a sound post setter tool. After spending about 40 minutes re-setting the sound post and replacing the A string and tuning I was ready to go. Ive had alot of fun practicing with it so far and I think its a good value for a student or adult beginner. It doesnt have a super sound but for this price what are you expecting?
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter this year when she wanted to try it out. I researched many of the rental companies, and honestly, this is a better deal!! The chin piece is a little large for my daughter, but she is so tall she needed a full size, so I'm not surprised it doesn't fit perfectly. Only 4 stars because the rosin we received was old and I had to toss it and buy new.
customer_reviews.author: amanda2012

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the look and the sound and the tuner/metronome that came with it. He's a second year violin student and outgrew his 1/4 size. The case is nice, includes everything you need. A great buy, and I'm glad I chose it.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for our beginner after the hand-me-down crapped out. It's an incredible deal for the money. The only complaint I have is that the liner on the case is super cheap, but does protect the violin well and keeps the case light.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer:)
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with the violin and everything that came with it. It is a great deal for the price and the quality is very good and the sound of the violin is beautiful and sounds more professional than I thought it would. It came fully assembled ~ I only needed to tune it which wasn't very hard. I currently am playing a 70 year old violin that has been in our family and wanted to upgrade to something a little nicer and am very pleased with the sound of this violin and would highly recommend this to a beginner/intermediate player. Very satisfied customer!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon E. Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: Great instrument, fun to learn!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy to have made this purchase when I did. For lack of finishing details, it makes up for in sound. I looked around and kept coming back to this one. Do a little research on basics like tuning. I was a beginner whom snapped a string not knowing what I was doing. I really enjoy playing around with this instrument. My neighbors don't hate me, they enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Elwell

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Received violin damaged. Contacted Cecilio customer service and was told to get it repaired at a shop. Returning item immediately and will no longer be providing this company with my business. Will be buying from a different company, hopefully with better results.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 year old daughter and she loves it! She learned how to use it now I'm glad I purchased this violin it's very durable and we have not had any problems with it so far . Great for her first violin . I do recommend this to any beginners.
customer_reviews.author: JESSIE

customer_reviews.title: A Good Violin for a Beginner
customer_reviews.text: To my unsophisticated ear the violin sounds good. It is very attractive finished in high-gloss varnish. I was mpredded by the way it was shipped and all the the box contained --violin, two bows, shoulder rest, chin rest, shoulder rest, beginners music book and well made case. A good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Bendrick

customer_reviews.title: Very nice package for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice package for the price. The violin has a nice full sound. The finish looks good and the case is quite decent, as are the bows. The tuner and shoulder rest could be better. I did have some trouble with pegs slipping, but noted some of the strings were not precisely would against the sides of the peg box. The pegs did take some work, but if you wind and set the strings properly, they now hold well.Overall I'm pleased with the package.
customer_reviews.author: J. Glover

customer_reviews.title: Great violin for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great violin for people who want to learn a new instrument for a cheap price. I bought this for something to do over quarantine since my classes are now online. Sound quality it pretty good, I spent some time looking and watching videos on cheaper violin reviews and this one was definitely one of the better picks. The only thing is that the shoulder rest that comes with this violin is super small (for kids I think) so as an adult I recommend you to buy another shoulder rest for it.
customer_reviews.author: Tsimnuj Xiong

customer_reviews.title: Sounds beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot of reviews on this violin, and saw lots of people saying that it was "unplayable " as soon as they got it. But the violin was sent with plainly written instructions of what to do when you first recieve it in order to properly ready your instrument for playing. After following the steps, and a few times tuning it (like all string instruments), there have been no flaws with my violin. Would completely recommend this for beginners who want to learn. I will revisit and update my review after awhile to see how it lasts with time.
customer_reviews.author: timothy g. woods

customer_reviews.title: Very short life.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son as a starter violin until he grew into a full size. Didn’t last long enough. Within 2 months a tuning peg broke, most of the strings broke as well shortly after. Overall this is what you pay for. If you’re serioualy going to play for more than a month, spend the better money ($600 or so is the basic range-Kennedy Violins for example) and skip the hassle of having to buy twice.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My son who’s 12 loves to play the violin and he’s actually really good at it. This violin is beautiful, very well crafted and sounds amazing. It is loud and bold, shiny and sturdy, the case is great and it’s lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Brodecky

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good violin.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second violin we've bought of this brand and we're pleased with it. The music store told us if we bought online to make sure and get this brand because it's the only one they trust online. Was good advice. The store was nice enough to inspect it for us and tune it and put finger strips on it for our child. Very cool, and I would recommend this for a nice price friendly option.
customer_reviews.author: J. Giles

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been using this as an entry level violin for a middle school class. Overall, I'm happy with the quality, price, sound. Her instructor even commented that it was a high quality instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very well constructed and very pleased
customer_reviews.text: My daughter started violin 3 months ago with a rental. We bought this violin and are quite pleased with it. It seems to be constructed quite well and tailpiece made it easy to do the fine adjustments. The added tuner was definitely a bonus and the violin was very easy to tune using it. I wasn’t sure what to expect but this was definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: BMETS RULE

customer_reviews.title: It's a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I don't know violin. A friend of mine came home last week and saw it and played it a little bit and said that the sound was descent. I told him the price and he frown the face in skepticism. I showed him online and he said he would buy one for his daughter. I would like to know if the Cecilio brand is twice better than the Mendini brand that is half the price for the same size. The case is descent and they give you precisely what they show you. We are happy.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel L Montero SR

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I would not even give 1 star if I did not have to. Bought this for my daughter and the strings broke off. Everything on the top of the violen just fell off. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. Only had it 2 months. Not repairable.
customer_reviews.author: roadking

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Each of the 4 (not just one or two) pegs keep slipping and so I can't even tune it to be able to start to play. So frustrating. They should at least include peg drops with the purchase if they aren't going to provide a decent product.
customer_reviews.author: Avi A

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first violin. My music instructor was surprised when I told him I bought it on Amazon. He said it is one of the better quality violins that he has seen his pupils use. As far as the sound, when he plays it, it sounds very nice. When I play it, it screeches, yells and screams. But I think that may be me and not the violin.
customer_reviews.author: LindaR

customer_reviews.title: Even my daughter's teacher was happy about the choice
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite impressed by the quality of this very inexpensive violin. For a student violin, this is quite enough. Even my daughter's teacher was happy about the choice. So save your big dollar, until your kids become an advanced player, they don't need anything more than this.
customer_reviews.author: ZP Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste time (With prime return money is safe)
customer_reviews.text: It does not play any music very bad quality. Just waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: SO

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: This violin looks great, sounds great and is just overall a great product. I've been playing for 13 years and I can tell you that the quality of this instrument is comparable to that of a violin that costs over $1000. All I had to do when I received it is just adjust the bridge a little and tune it up. Everything that came with the violin was great quality also. I recommend this to anyone that is looking for a good quality violin at an inexpensive price.
customer_reviews.author: eyezayuh

customer_reviews.title: Best first time violin
customer_reviews.text: So this is my daughter’s first year of playing the violin. I thought why is this reasonably priced vs renting one at the music store out $200 and nothing to show by renting. Then buying one at music store over $600 dollars. I bought this and even went to the music store and compared it appears to be of very good quality and the big difference is price. If you need a professional violin then buy from music store. First timers it is perfect
customer_reviews.author: StacyS

customer_reviews.title: Oder extra strings
customer_reviews.text: Good beginner set does not come with extra strings. One string broke upon initial Tuning. Wasn’t over tuned yet the string broke. I ordered two ne string sets and is fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Aguon

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE QUALITY-DON’T BUY
customer_reviews.text: I got this violin as a beginner violinist, but I played guitar enough to know stringed instruments. I opened the box, and found not only the tuning pegs poorly crafted, with most barely even able to stay in, but I also found the strings terribly attached to the pegs, rounded about so terribly that I couldn’t even tune the violin well enough. Overall, the quality was poor and I wouldn’t recommend to anyone, but hey, at least the two strings that I got properly tuned played well.
customer_reviews.author: TannerJacobi

customer_reviews.title: Feels high quality, missing second bow & tuner
customer_reviews.text: Violin appears beautiful and high quality as described. Received violin, case, 1 bow, bridge installed, one extra bridge, chest piece, and resin. I haven’t played it yet, but I do notice that it only had one bow (describes it is supposed to come with 2 bows) and it is also missing the tuner. Besides the two missing items it says it comes with in the description everything else appears as described. Odd enough I like the violin so much that it’s not bothering me I am missing a tuner and extra bow I was supposed to get.
customer_reviews.author: scott c mason

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: I decided to learn to play the violin, so I have no professional experience but it sounds good to me and seems well built. The only thing is that you definitely need to rosin up the bow.....take some emery cloth and scratch the rosin up first.
customer_reviews.author: utaker

customer_reviews.title: String broke only after 1st use
customer_reviews.text: very cheap quality of strings broke on first use I bought it seeing other reviews giving decent review but it seems horrible
customer_reviews.author: herc

customer_reviews.title: bad quality
customer_reviews.text: arrived about one week ago. the fine tunner scree were broken already.
customer_reviews.author: Weihua Cai

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a good price!
customer_reviews.text: I had not played the violin in years and recently got back into playing it (I play multiple stringed instruments, piano and cello being my main instruments of choice). This violin is the perfect beginners package. The body is well shaped and has a lovely color. It does not look cheaply made and has a good sound. I have heard better violins, but this violin has a great sound for the price. It also comes with 2 bows, a tuner, shoulder rest and rosin. Again, this violin is great quality for the price. I am strongly recommending this package to any new violin students that may come my way. -Mrs. Barbercheck
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: I read the description and reviews. I was glad it came with everything I needed including the upgraded strings. I watched YouTube and they suggested these type of strings. I went to my first lesson and my teacher was impressed by the Violin and what it included. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: DIANN A KOEHLER

customer_reviews.title: Violin
customer_reviews.text: This item was for a gift, received well packaged and was very beautiful. well received by person it was intended.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Another gift for my gf, she was so happy for her birthday gift. However it does not stay tuned and only sounds similar to a violin
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Reviews

customer_reviews.title: great deal for the beginner
customer_reviews.text: for the price, this is a fine violin for the beginner who is just learning and is obviously not going to demand too much from the instrument. the shoulder rest didnt really work for me, so i purchased a Vale adjustable shoulder rest that is a better fit. i like that it includes two bows. i named the violin Scratchy and the bow Itchy. they certainly have lived up to their names, but that is more a reflection on my playing than on the actual violin and bow.
customer_reviews.author: michael j.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Have played guitar and percussion for 30+ years. This will be a new experience for me. The instrument is of good quality. I had no trouble tuning it. Already playing - you guessed it - Twinkle Twinkle Little Star. Good time. Holds the tune even after hours of ‘fiddling’ around.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E Kilmer, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price, but there is a noticeable difference in sound between this and other instruments (even with the same skill level). The notes aren't different per se, they just sound different due to the construction, I assume. The bows also aren't that great, the hairs come loose easily.
customer_reviews.author: Konnor

customer_reviews.title: Popular with students but a quality starter violin for older adults too!
customer_reviews.text: I love this entry level violin, they’ve had complete beginners in mind and they have included everything you might need. Buying this violin makes everything easier since you won’t have to hunt for any additional violin accessories! The strings are really good, having two bows included is just amazing
customer_reviews.author: unclenate

customer_reviews.title: It is a good price for a 7 year old beginner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this violin for my daughter who began violin lessons. It is a good price for a 7 year old beginner. The violin is nice and comes with everything you need.
customer_reviews.author: Knat

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Strings were broken and it was incapable of tuning because the pegs were to small and it didn’t come with any of the necessary oil to fill the wholes. Definitely it for beginners or person of any level.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Spivack

customer_reviews.title: Great craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: My older daughter plays violin and I got two of these for my twins. I am very pleased with Blythe quality for the price. Let's not kid ourselves here, it doesn't compare to some of the expensive violins out there however it's above all the ones we have rented in the past. Great setup and easy to tune.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M Belt

customer_reviews.title: Had to return.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return. The music teacher said you cannot tune it.
customer_reviews.author: gosia

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: So for 200 bucks you can’t beat this violin for a beginner. The tuning pegs are not perfectly fitted and do sometimes slip but it isn’t a big deal to re-tune the instrument. I probably re-tune it once a week so it isn’t like it’s happening every day. Overall Fantastic experience and I would purchase again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: tnelson1134

customer_reviews.title: Daughter went from thrilled on christmas morning to sad. Real
customer_reviews.text: missing one string when it came, and cannot get consistent tension on the three it has. Daughter went from thrilled on christmas morning to sad. Real bummer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bargain for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I don't know anything about violins. My teenage daughter decided to learn and we bought this one. Her instructor said she had a nice instrument to learn on so I feel confident in our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a BEAUTIFUL instrument! It came with crappy Rosin
customer_reviews.text: This is a BEAUTIFUL instrument! It came with crappy Rosin, but the bow was alright at least. The tuner was broken, but surprise - there is an ap for that! So it really was not a big deal. The biggest part I was worried about was the instrument itself and that part was nearly prefect. It was a gift for my husband and he loves it!!! The case is also sturdy and the shipping was insanely fast! Overall very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was my wedding gift for my husband who always talked about wanting to learn the violin. For the price you pay it is a great buy for anyone interested in checking out the instrument.
customer_reviews.author: MN-Wholockian

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: The violin is beautiful and comes with everything you need. You might want to get some better quality rosin, I would suggest black rosin. If you are new to the violin like I was when I got this please take it to a luthier and have them tune it and check it over. The case is well made and it comes with two bows which will work fine after you get the rosin on them good.
customer_reviews.author: Rapid

customer_reviews.title: I love my violin
customer_reviews.text: I love my violin. It sounds great and plays nicely. I'm a beginner with a few lessons under my belt so I still have more learning to go. My only complaints with this violin is that the shoulder rest wasn't comfortable or easy to maneuver and the E string slips sometimes. I ended up purchasing a new shoulder rest and have just been very careful with the E string. Overall, couldn't have asked for a better violin to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Glover

customer_reviews.title: Had to take to repair shop out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Had to have the nut shaved down, replace the bridge, and replace the strings. Not too happy, but now that that work has been done, it's a decent violin. Sounds good.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Not a good item
customer_reviews.text: I had one more item from same brand for my elder son. Worked very good and still working. But this item was bad. So retuned and bought another better quality one from other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mahesh

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value
customer_reviews.text: Received new violin in pristine condition. Has a very clean and open sound that's simply amazing for the price, and stays in tune better than my expensive guitar... The shoulder rest that comes with this kit, however, is a flimsy piece of junk that seems designed to hit every sensitive pressure point on your shoulder and collar bone. I'd recommend picking up a proper shoulder rest at your earliest convenience, your body will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Very nice violin for a beginner - came with a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice violin for a beginner - came with a lot of extras and sounds wonderful. I've played violin for 15+ years and got this for my 9 year old for school as he wants to play - so nice and very pleased with the order.
customer_reviews.author: corrie

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect example of a beautiful beginner's violin.
customer_reviews.text: Decided to learn to play the violin. Been a dream sesne I was a kid. So decided to do research about begginer violin's, this was the best price and best reviewed violin. You can't get better then this with a good set of string's as well. Absolutely fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery and the violin looks beautiful. Our 8 year will be so excited.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant. Beautiful. Decent sound. Good packaging etc. The tuner that comes with this is pretty much s***. You don't need it, a violin tuner app on your phone is much better and easier. You need to tune up ever 2sessions or 3-4 days.
customer_reviews.author: Shubham Saxena

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Needed better strings so I had to have the violin serviced right away. Otherwise, the professional that changed the strings confirmed it’s a fairly good beginner instrument. The metronome that came with the violin doesn’t work despite putting a brand new battery in it. The book was also pretty unhelpful and I had to do extra research to get the basics down.
customer_reviews.author: Ky

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Violin
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are right. For the money I do not think you can do better. I am just starting violin, (played classical piano when in the 3rd grade, and French Horn through High School), but can already tell this is a quality instrument. Great package!!
customer_reviews.author: Spot On

customer_reviews.title: Good Value.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this violin it had some missing items. Sent it back as extra strings were also missing - received second order extra strings missing again. Other than that violin looks very nice - will need to be tuned. I had to send back due to the missing items. Will say everything looks good - someone noted the bows are not well made. I agree from apprearence only - as I did not play the insturment. Worth the money if you get all the items listed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Polk

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good instrument for a beginner and is very much good ...
customer_reviews.text: I have played fiddle for over 30 years. Due to my instrument breaking down, I needed something quickly. I honestly expected this to be junk. I was very surprised. It doesn’t have the tonal character of an expensive violin, BUT, it absolutely gets the job done. It’s a good instrument for a beginner and is very much good enough eafor a backup for a better instrument. I don’t think you can beat it for the money. I rarely post reviews. I thought this was worthy of one.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Burks

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous and Capable
customer_reviews.text: Really amazing! Perfect for the more higher end student-quality violin! Perfect for beginners and entering the intermediate level.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: great for trying out without paying for the real thing
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to have a violin to play around with to see if I liked it, but I didn't feel like dropping $500 on the real thing. it works as long as you follow the direction. don't tune like the hulk. do one string one or two notes at a time, otherwise it throws the bridge off and you could snap the strings if you stretch them too fast. doesn't sound great but it plays. I'll make a real investment if I find myself playing for a while. otherwise, no guilt on this purchase. only wondering if the $80 violins are any different
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Martinez

product_meta.title: Cecilio CVN-300 Solidwood Ebony Fitted Violin with D'Addario Prelude Strings (Size 4/4 (Full Size), Varnish)
product_meta.description: Size:Size 4/4 (Full Size)| Color:VarnishTeacher approved Cecilio CVN-300 orchestra violin is perfect for beginner to intermediate violinist. It features hand-carved solid spruce top, hand-carved maple back and sides and finished with a beautiful antique varnish and inlaid purfling. The CVN-300 violin is strung with a set of D'Addario Prelude Strings and is fitted with ebony fingerboard, pegs, chinrest, and tailpiece with nickel plated fine tuners. Violin package includes Cecilio chromatic tuner with metronome, a lesson book, a lightweight form fitting hard shell case with pockets and strap (making it convenient to carry to school or orchestra), 2 (two) Brazil wood bow with unbleached genuine Mongolian horsehair, adjustable shoulder rest with soft foam padding & soft rubber feet, quality rosin cake, and a violin bridge. Buy with confidence as it comes with a 1- year warranty against any manufacturer's defects.
feature_bullets: Size 4/4 (full size) violin with solid spruce wood top, maple back, neck and sides with inlaid purfling in antique varnish
Ebony fingerboard, pegs chinrest, and tailpiece with 4 detachable nickel plated fine tuners

Includes: Cecilio chromatic tuner, lesson book, lightweight hard case, 2 x Brazilwood bows with unbleached genuine Mongolian horsehair, quality rosin cake, adjustable shoulder rest, and an extra bridge
Note: Does not include extra set of strings.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,116 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
